definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book
to swear an oath (of office)/to make a vow
to swear the oath of office
to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
to pledge undying love (idiom); oath of eternal love/to swear by all the Gods
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints

sentences.english: So he swore an oath to him, selling his birthright to Jacob.
sentences.chinese: 以扫就对他起了誓，把长子的名分卖给雅各。

sentences.english: The beautiful topiary trees are witnesses of our marriage.
sentences.chinese: 浪漫鲜花柱见证我们的婚盟约誓。

sentences.english: Well ain't this a bitch, girl you swore, you promised.
sentences.chinese: 我没说骚货，女孩你发过誓的，你保证过的。

sentences.english: I have sworn-fat, and so I never go home after earning money.
sentences.chinese: 我曾经发过誓，等我挣钱以后决不再回家。

sentences.english: I vow to adhere to the disciplinary rules promulgated by the Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 恪遵佛陀所制戒律规范，誓不违犯。

sentences.english: Swear No man, light and will be sworn in.
sentences.chinese: 绝无好人，轻于言誓而必心存背叛。

sentences.english: Then Jacob took an oath by the Fear of his father Isaac.
sentences.chinese: 雅各伯就指自己的父亲依撒格所敬畏的上主起了誓。

sentences.english: Vows made in storms are forgotten in calms.
sentences.chinese: 激动时所立的誓，平静时会忘记的。

sentences.english: Astro Boy, however, promises to be different.
sentences.chinese: 然而，铁臂阿童木却誓必与众不同。

sentences.english: Remember you are under oath. I am.
sentences.chinese: 您要记得您可是宣了誓的啊。

sentences.english: "Yes, I swore it, but I didn't mean it," said Shahzad.
sentences.chinese: “是的，我发了誓，但没有当真，”沙扎德说。

definition: to swear to God/to cross one's heart
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
to be as good as one's word (idiom)/to keep one's promise
Thaksin Shinawatra (1949-), Thai businessman and politician, prime minister 2001-2006
lit. to grow fat eating one's words (idiom)/fig. not to live up to one's promises
